title: Capability Instruction Tuning: A New Paradigm for Dynamic LLM Routing
author: Yi-Kai Zhang (Nanjing University), De-Chuan Zhan (Nanjing University), Han-Jia Ye (Nanjing University), ...
relevance_why: The concept of routing models based on capability instructions could be valuable for developing more efficient audio and speech models, potentially applying similar strategies in hierarchical audio processing or generation tasks.
background: This paper explores how to dynamically route instructions to the best-performing Large Language Model (LLM) from a pool of models to improve overall performance without incurring inference overhead.
contribution: The paper introduces the MODEL-SAT framework to utilize capability instructions for model selection, achieving improved routing accuracy across various tasks and models.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous model routing methods often require access to inference outputs for comparison, leading to significant computational overhead.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by employing a lightweight model capable of generating capability representations based on limited data, thus eliminating the need for extensive inference prior to routing.

key_innovation: Combines model capability representations with user instructions in a single framework to enhance model routing efficiency.
real_world_impact: Enhanced routing methods could lead to more efficient applications of LLMs in real-world scenarios, promoting cost-effective and resource-efficient AI deployment.
limitations: The paper does not explicitly mention limitations regarding the generalizability of its framework beyond the tested LLM zoos.

new_terms.capability instruction: **Capability instruction** is a composite input format used to assess the suitability of an LLM for specific tasks by integrating model capabilities and performance inquiry prompts.
